page.title: 09DEANERY FARM NR. BAMPTON
page.content: The farmer, his son and 2 employees farm this 500 acre farm. They have a herd of 90{Charollais}cows and rear calves for{beef}. They also grow{ {winter wheat and barley.}The cattle are brought in out of the cold in November and kept in a barn on straw. The calves are born in February and all the animals go out to grass in the Spring. The manure from the barn is put out on the fields in Autumn. Haymaking for Winter feed begins in June/July and square bales are still used as the farmer finds round bales too large and heavy for the men to lift. A{windpump}is used to provide water for the fields. The farmhouse was originally in{Bampton}but{public {pressure}from the village over the farm's pigs persuaded the farmer to move out of the present site. The old farm buildings are converted to homes.
